body.name: Vital House First Aid Kit for Home and Travel, Office, Car, School, Business, 326 Emergency Supplies Included
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 15 hrs 1 min
features: Everything You Need, Exactly When You Need It: You never know when an emergency will strike; Be prepared with this compact home & car first aid kit offering over 300 vital first aid supplies
Exclusive Extras Add Extra Convenience: Our trauma kit provides valuable tools you won't find in most first aid kits, such as a battery-free flashlight plus a pair of tweezers with magnifying glass

Comes with Exclusive Extras: Looking for all-inclusive first aid kits? Our trauma kit has all your crucial first aid kit refill supplies plus a battery-free flashlight and tweezers with magnifying glass

Puts It All Right at Your Fingertips: We've divided our emergency car kit into 4 organized sections, each clearly labeled for quick and easy access; We've even included a step-by-step First Aid Manual
Easy to Transport Anywhere: Our portable mini first aid kit measures just 11.73" x 9.45" x 6.5", weighs only 2.84 lbs., and has sure-grip hook-&-loop backing for attaching to car seats and backpacks

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Because You and Your Family Matter You're concerned for the well-being of your loved ones. So, naturally, you want to make extra-sure you have the right supplies on hand if and when an emergency arises. Vital House to the rescue. Our all-purpose home first aid kit provides more than 300 first-aid essentials – and puts them right there at your fingertips in 4 spacious compartments, each clearly labeled for easy, instant access. We’ve Thought of Everything – And Then Some More Our adult, child, and baby first aid kit gives you more than just band-aids and bandages, scissors and safety pins, burn gel and blister pad, thermometer and tourniquet, gauze, gloves, and an emergency blanket. It also offers valuable extras: a mini-flashlight that needs no batteries; a Steri-Strip for sterile wound care; and unique tweezers with an attached magnifying glass so you can clearly see what you’re tweezing. Easy to Carry Anywhere, Indoors and Out Use it as a camping, cycling, and hiking first aid kit. Take it on treks to the trails, jaunts to the gym, and trips to the park and playground. Hang it by its long, adjustable strap from your tote, stroller, or hammock. Plus, attach it with its sure-grip hook-&-loop backing to your backpack or passenger seat. At under 3 lbs., it won’t weigh you down, even on strenuous hikes. From Our Adventurous Family to Yours We know what it’s like to face sudden emergencies in unexpected places. That’s why we developed this molle-compatible first aid kit to tackle practically any crisis – at home, at school, at work, or out in the wild. With over 300 items in 48 categories, it gives you all the precision tools you’ll need to treat minor injuries, wounds, cuts, scrapes, burns, colds, fevers, and more.

Tough Water-Resistant Construction Our emergency kits are carefully crafted from durable polyester with an extra-dense 600-denier weave that resists ripping and tearing. Plus, they’re specially coated to guard against moisture, so you can use them in all conditions, from drizzle to sudden downpours. The two-way zipper glides smoothly for snag-free ease, while the rugged reinforced stitching resists fraying and raveling. Hook-&-Loop Backing Sticks to Virtually Anything Easily attach your Vital House Kit to practically any surface, from a pegboard in your garage to a tree at your camping site. The detachable hook-&-look back panel adheres firmly to most backpacks, car seats, and more. Prefer to hang your kit on your handlebars or toss it over your shoulder? No problem. It has a sturdy, adjustable shoulder strap plus a handy easy-grip top strap for comfortable carrying. Organized and Labeled for Your Convenience Your Vital House First Aid Kit has 4 roomy inner sections, each with its own clearly visible label: Cuts and Scrapes; Medication and Wound Care; Fracture and Sprain; Outdoors and First Aid Manual. So, you can grab what you need in an instant – vitally important in any emergency. Great Gift for Travelers and Families with Children Know anyone who loves to hike, camp, bicycle, or enjoy other outdoor adventures? Or perhaps a young couple whose little kids are prone to booboos and accidents? They’ll appreciate this practical, portable kit, nicely packaged for gracious gifting. It’s a perfect present for homeschool moms, classroom teachers, daycare professionals, and all other childcare workers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Vital House First Aid Kit, 326 Emergency Supplies Included
reviews.reviewText: This is an impressive array of first aid supplies (much more than was shown in the first product image), in a sturdy well-organized pack with labeled pockets. It comes packed and ready to go, and includes a thorough illustrated inventory sheet (shown in the second product image) to help you identify everything inside. The bright red ballistic nylon and bold white labeling on the exterior make it clearly identifiable as a first aid kit from a distance. I'd had a much smaller first aid kit pouch and had been acquiring supplies one-by-one locally; this is a great upgrade.In addition to a typical carrying handle, there are multiple additional options for attaching the kit to other items. There are two thick plastic D-rings at the top of the back panel. There are two MOLLE-compatible straps on the back, with snaps on their bottom ends. And there is a longer strap with a plastic buckle, which initially comes wrapped around to the front of the case, but can be deployed to the back of the case to strap it around something instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice bag packed with so many things
reviews.reviewText: I work in a field of medicine where I deal with acute wounds and injuries often. My overall perspective on this kit would be that they are not the highest quality individual supplies, but incredibly good value. For the average family, this is a fantastic buy. I would add some simple ibuprofen/tylenol and call it a day for most people.To start off, the bag itself is very functional and although the labels seem a bit random as they are not perfectly on the dot for the things packed inside, are nice if you want to reorganize. This thing is packed with many things that would take most people a lot of effort to search and purchase separately and it will definitely cost significantly more than this collection. In terms of quality, they may not be the highest quality, but definitely would work very well as a layperson for almost all injuries for which this is designed for. Likely, most people will probably not use most things in this kit so there is no need for the absolute best. There are also a few random nice items like light sticks and even a hand crank flash light. This flashlight is actually surprisingly good, it looks cheap but its very easy to use, don't need batteries, and actually brightens my room fairly well when it is normally 100% dark (see my photo).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Packed with a very wide variety of supplies.
reviews.reviewText: Although it would add some weight to a backpack, this kit does has nice straps to make it easy to take along on long hiking trips. It also has things that are helpful on a day-to-day basis around the house, such as the variety of bandaids, digital thermometer and tweezers attached to a magnifying glass for removing splinters. There is also a little flashlight (powered by squeezing the handle) for power outages.Since items made with rubber and plastic seem to deteriorate more quickly in the trunk of my car during extreme weather, I probably will leave the kit for use in the house, unless I am going on a longer trips, so the rubber gloves and bandaids will get more use. I have a small bathroom and don’t have room for medical supplies there, so this kit will be kept downstairs for us to grab as needed and refilled with additional supplies whenever these are depleted.Random note: I did think the ace bandages seemed smaller than what I would typically buy, and the thermometer seemed a little flimsy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Over all a good deal
reviews.reviewText: First aid kits like this can be a wild grab bag of almost useful goods. This is a fairly well thought out kit. The case is brilliant and gives you plenty of options to stowing and transporting the whole kit.I do think that the sheer volume of space dedicated to adhesive bandages might be adjusted to make room for a NAR CAT tourniquet, vented chest seal, and or some hemostatic bandages or powder.The included (empty) pill box would do well to be a little more generous in capacity. Depending on what you choose to carry (e.g., pain relievers, antihistamines, anti-diarrheals, anti-nausea, etc.) there will either be several circumstances for which you have a single dose, or numerous circumstances you aren't ready for at all.)Everyone should always customize your first aid kit for circumstances you're likely to encounter, but I think this kit makes some strange assumptions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a must have for sure!
reviews.reviewText: This is the ultimate first aid kit to have on hand IN CASE of an emergency. I got this to keep in my truck cause you never know when a family member or a stranger on the side of the road will need my help. Great for those who go fishing, camping, hunting, trail walking, or just because you have children. This is one of those items you NEED to have in hand because it’s better to have and not need then NEED it and not have it! The case itself is a very nice, durable, like thick book bag material is the best I can explain it.It literally has everything you could need in an emergency to hold you over until you can get help. Al kinds of different band aids, gauze rolls and pads, cleaning wipes for cuts, a flashlight! Glow sticks, a digital thermometer, the mist goes on and on…48 different items with a lot of which have multiples of each.I’m really impressed with this and that is in all honesty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything you need
reviews.reviewText: Luckily, I haven't had to use any of the contents yet but there is so much packed into a fairly small container. They use all the available space and it's really well organized and labeled. It's a has pretty much anything you need for any minor injury. It's so handy to have whether at home or to stick in the trunk of your car just in case of an emergency. Knowing I have all the essentials in case someone is unexpectedly hurt is a comfort. I usually carry bandaids but this also has an emergency blanket, cooling packs, ace bandages, flashlight, tweezers -- so many things I hadn't considered before. I would definitely recommend this kit.
